etymologies: early 21st century: from the name of the British political journalist Robert Fisk (born 1946), whose articles have been refuted in a point-by-point way by various bloggers

definitions: refute the points made in (an article or other piece of writing) one by one

examples.text: I was going to fisk their entire editorial, but if they're not going to take their work seriously then neither am I

shortDefinitions: rebut points of article one by one
